description: Featured L2 for Oracle—low fees, high throughput, and tight Coinbase ecosystem integrations. Many routes settle or traverse Base for speed and cost efficiency.

Oracle's execution rail for swap/bridge/send. Relay's relayers fill on the destination chain first, then settle cheaply—abstracting chain switching with predictable fees, SLAs, and 75+ network coverage.

Auth + wallet infrastructure. Users connect existing wallets or get an embedded, self-custodial wallet. Secure key sharding, customizable UI, and multi-wallet control power a seamless sign-in and signing flow.
Market data for the Chart page: live OHLCV, liquidity, pool stats, and recent trades used to inform pre-filled swaps.
Discovery layer for pairs across chains. Feeds FDV, volume, and liquidity context into search, coins lists, and quick market views.
Community coin and trend signals. Powers parts of coin discovery and complements social context in the feed.
Fiat → crypto on-ramp inside Buy. MFA sign-in, KYC where required, and diverse payment methods; Oracle can auto-swap post-checkout if the target token isn't purchasable directly.
The Farcaster client linked from Oracle's social feed. Lets users jump to profiles and casts that correspond to on-chain activity.
Creator of Oracle. NYC-based team building fast, user-first crypto applications on the Ethereum stack and Superchain.
Managed EVM indexing for Oracle's feed. High-speed backfills and streaming pipelines enrich DEX swaps and map activity to identities.
Analytics and dashboards used for internal research, monitoring, and cross-chain market context.
One of the DEX sources indexed for the social feed—public swaps are ingested and shown with explorer links.
Core DEX source (v2/v3) for feed activity and price context. Trades can be mirrored via Oracle's pre-filled routes.
DEX source for on-chain activity, especially on BNB and supported L2s. Public swaps appear in the feed with quick replay.
